page.title: 08HOMELIFE: TEDSTONE DELAMERE
page.content: Homelife of farmers centre on the farmer which provides household food and fuel. Meat, fruit and vegetables are frozen, wine made. Aga cookers used for cooking and heating. Farmers' wives act as secretarys, and work locally as teachers. Children travel daily to State, or private schools. Parents and children ride for pleasure. Farmers shoot game. Main meal eaten at midday. Most households keep pet, working or guard dogs. Professional and business people commute to Birmingham or Worcester, have well kept gardens and houses with central heating, and all modern domestic appliances. There are daily deliveries of mail and milk. Mobile Library visits are monthly. Some people attend church regularly. Majority would have and annual holiday. Most families have two cars.
